definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to wait/to inquire after/to watch/season/climate/(old) period of five days

sentences.english: It is well known for its warm micro-climate favorable to lemon, tangerine, and orange groves.
sentences.chinese: 這是衆所周知的溫暖小氣候有利於檸檬，橘子，橙園。

sentences.english: Soil surface mulching was one of important method to improve the agricultural microclimate.
sentences.chinese: 地面覆蓋法是改善農業小氣候的一種重要措施。

sentences.english: At the same time, the introduction of green plants is also greatly improved the high-level Construction of micro-climate.
sentences.chinese: 同時綠色植物的引入也大大改善了高層建築的小氣候。

sentences.english: With terrorism, there is "big circumstance" and "small climate" in China.
sentences.chinese: 恐怖主義在中國存在着“大環境”與“小氣候”。

sentences.english: Given the huge size of the world, are there any microclimates?
sentences.chinese: 既然有如此巨大的遊戲世界，是否有一些小氣候。

sentences.english: The micro-climate characteristics of the wetland had an obvious "cold-humid effect".
sentences.chinese: 因此該溼地的小氣候特徵表現爲“冷溼效應”顯著。

sentences.english: Several studies of the microclimatic conditions on the site have informed the planning of the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 場地上小氣候條件的幾項研究也結合了景觀規劃。

sentences.english: Effects of straw and residue mulching on microclimate of summer corn field.
sentences.chinese: 麥秸和殘茬覆蓋對夏玉米農田小氣候的影響。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, dry-warm microclimate directly causes scarcity of wetland water resource.
sentences.chinese: 而小氣候乾暖化直接造成溼地水資源量匱乏。

sentences.english: Branch hill seems to have it's own micro-climate and it's a cold one.
sentences.chinese: 山的支脈上似乎有它自己的小氣候，是很冷的那種。

sentences.english: Microclimates are created by the effects of altitude and aspect.
sentences.chinese: 受海風和地貌影響形成了小氣候。
